title: British financial advisor Citicourt & Co plots space venture capital fund
summary: TAMPA, Fla. — British financial advisor Citicourt & Co is looking to raise 100 million pounds ($129 million) in its first venture capital fund to invest in sustainability-focused space opportunities. […]

title: 60 Years Ago: Ranger 7 Photographs the Moon
summary: Long before Apollo astronauts set foot upon the Moon, much remained unknown about the lunar surface. While most scientists believed the Moon had a solid surface that would support astronauts and their landing craft, some believed a deep layer of dust covered it that would swallow any visitors. Until 1964, no closeup photographs of the […]

title: Atlas V prepares to fly its last ever national security mission
summary: United Launch Alliance, formed in 2006 to merge the Boeing and Lockheed Martin launch vehicle programs, has flown 99 national security missions over the last 18 years using the Delta II, Delta IV, and Atlas V rocket families. USSF-51 will be ULA’s 100th national security launch, and the last ever flown by an Atlas-family rocket.

title: PLACES team publishes blog post on NextGenScience Blog
summary: The NASA Science Activation program’s PLACES (Broadening Data Fluency Through the Integration of NASA Assets and Place-Based Learning to Advance Connections, Education, and Stewardship) team – which focuses on supporting educators to implement Place-Based, Data-Rich (PBDR) instruction using NASA assets in their own contexts – recently published a blog post about the PLACES PBDR framework […]

title: Peekaboo!
summary: In this image from May 4, 2017, a rabbit is nearly obscured by grass at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Kennedy shares a border with the Merritt Island Wildlife Refuge, which is home to over 31 mammal species and hundreds of bird, fish, amphibian, and reptile species. Kennedy is responsible for more protected species […]
